intro: Campylosporus angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved campylospore, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
